column4: i mean i see my drives as /media/hda1 /hda2 etc but iam not able to see whats there inside it
i mean i can see partition 1 partiton 2 partition 3 in disk manager
but when i enable it nothing happens
nothinghappens i get the command prompt
my /media/hda2 is NTFS  hda1 and hda3 r vfat
i dont have a fstab directory
surely you have a regular file /etc/fstab
run `sudo gedit /etc/fstab`, for the partitions in question add what i said next to "defaults" (the options column)
read what ubotu said, that should be the easier ubuntu way
well, remove the hda1, sda5-7 lines from fstab..
put a # in front of all ntfs/vfat lines
that script is stupid, you will have to actually remove the lines from fstab
cut and paste them to a temporary file
